title: Since Nexus Blitz is going to be a permanent alternative to Summoner's Rift...
body: Can we make Summoner's Rift the 40-50 minute mode again and give Nexus Blitz the 15-20 minute games?

And while at it they should consider some major balance changes for Summoners Rift, as specially when it comes to early game bursting and snowballing. 

Since they are going to be releasing a dominion alternative mode, where people can just blow each other up as soon as they respawn non stop.

* First major change would be to nerf damage across the whole Rune system when playing in Summoners Rift.
* Buff defensive items for damage dealers in Summoners Rift.
* Nerf certain items (Trinity Sheen Part, Stormrazor, Duskblade) in Summoners Rift.
* Nerf offensive summoner spell efficiency in Summoners Rift (ignite).
* Make Towers strong in Summoners Rift (increase their damage, increase their health and stats).
* Change Rift Herald to not be a tower based objective in Summoners Rift (not an essential change, but one that could be considered).

Then once some of these changes are considered and would be applied, anything else that could prove to still cause major snowballing could be slowly nerfed from there on.

>Experimental modes are gameplay prototypes designed to deliver a different kind of experience distinct from Summoner’s Rift, Twisted Treeline, or ARAM. They’re also different than rotating game modes like URF, Doom Bots, and One For All in a few key ways:
>
>With experimental modes, we're looking for something that could last a while—maybe even as a permanent addition to League. They’re not tied to a particular event, and our hope for each mode is that it's compelling enough to play over and over again, and to be a regular mode-of-choice for many players. If an experimental mode doesn't meet that bar, we'll set it aside and explore other ideas.

at 45 lategame champions already outscaled  the early game bullies so making the games  last an average of 45 minutes would mean that lategame picks wins by default
